dt: {bc}a usually long and complex sonata for symphony orchestra
{bc}a musical composition (as for organ) resembling such a symphony in complexity or variety
{bc}consonance or harmony of color (as in a painting)
{bc}something that in its harmonious complexity or variety suggests a {a_link|symphonic} composition

et: Middle English {it}symphonie{/it}, from Middle French, from Latin {it}symphonia{/it}, from Greek {it}symphōnia{/it}, from {it}symphōnos{/it} concordant in sound, from {it}syn-{/it} + {it}phōnē{/it} voice, sound {ma}{mat|ban:1|}{/ma}
